idlib.entity_linking¶

Running Entity Linking¶

Entity linking works by following an already created Neo4j knowledge graph schema. The schema defines which terminologies each concept type will be linked to. These terminologies are instantiated according to annotator.ini.

python run_entity_linking.py --concepts_file path/to/concepts.jsonl \
                             --outfile path/to/outfile.jsonl \
                             --annotator_conf path/to/annotator.ini \
                             --uri neo4j_schema_uri \
                             --user neo4j_username \
                             --password neo4j password

Linkers¶

class idlib.entity_linking.linkers.EntityLinker(name)[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract class for doing entity linking.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of this entity linker.

get_best_links(candidate_links, **kwargs)[source]¶

Given a set of candidate links for a set of input strings returned by EntityLinker.link(), choose the “best” linking for each input string from among the candidate links.

Parameters

candidate_links (dict) – Dictionary of input strings to candidate linkings.

Returns

candidate_links filtered to include only the “best” links.

Return type

list

link(queries, **kwargs)[source]¶

Link query or list of queries to entities in the corresponding database. Input should be a sequence of (ID, text pairs). Outputs a nested dictionary of the format

{input_string: {matched_input: CandidateLink}}.

Parameters

input_strings (list) – List of (ID, string) pairs to link.

Returns

Dictionary of input strings to CandidateLink instances.

Return type

dict

class idlib.entity_linking.MetaMapDriver(name='metamap', mm_bin='', data_year='2018AB', data_version='Base', min_score=800, term_processing=False, relaxed_model=True, keep_semtypes=None)[source]¶

Bases: idlib.entity_linking.linkers.EntityLinker

Class to start and use a MetaMap instance from within Python.

Parameters

  • mm_bin (str) – path to MetaMap bin/ directory.

  • data_year (str) – corresponds to the -V option. E.g. ‘2018AA’

  • data_version (str) – corresponds to the -Z option. E.g. ‘Base’

  • min_score (int) – minimum score of a candidate mapping to keep.

get_best_links(candidate_links, keep_top_n=1)[source]¶

Returns the candidate link with the highest score for each input term. The output format is

{input_id: {phrase_text: CandidateLink}}.

Warning! If two or more concepts are tied, one will be returned at random.

Parameters

mappings (dict) – dict of candidate mappings. Output of self.map.

Returns

The best candidate mapping for each input term.

Return type

dict

link(queries, call_options=None)[source]¶

Link a query or list of queries to UMLS concepts. Outputs a nested dictionary of the format

{input_id: {phrase_text: [CandidateLink, […]]}}.

Parameters

  • queries (list) – list of queries to send to MetaMap

  • term_processing (bool) – process a list of terms rather than a list of texts. (default False).

  • call_options (str) – other command line options to pass to metamap. (default None)

  • keep_semtypes (dict) – If list, list of semantic types to include. If dict, maps input IDs to list of semantic types to keep. (default None)

Returns

mapping from input to UMLS concepts

Return type

dict

Given a set of candidate links for a set of input strings returned by EntityLinker.link(), choose the N “best” linkings for each input string from among the candidate links.

Returns
